FacilityName: Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility

_prev_prog_3.Description:
Rich Product Corporation - Morristown I Facility's ammonia refrigeration system is designed to minimize the potential of an ammonia release.  The facility has in place the following for the ammonia refrigeration system:  preventative maintenance procedures and records, automatic alarm systems, ammonia detectors and ventilation system, process safety information tracking logs, automatic system shutdown capabilities, periodic leak and pressure testing, periodic visual inspections, control valves, refrigeration hand service valves for manual operation, solenoid valves, pressure relief valves, computer generated work orders for maintenance,  and hot work permits.



The facility's administrative procedures are as follows:  periodic training for associates, compliance audits, pre-startup safety checks, process hazard analysis to address what-if scenarios and the measures taken to mitigate a release,  screening of all contractors performing work on the ammonia refrigeration system per OSHA and USEPA regulations, and management of change procedures.



Compressors have the following safeguards:  pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping, high and low temperature alarms and shutdown, high and low pressure alarms and shutdown, high and low level oil alarms and shutdown, high and low oil temperature alarms and shutdown, high and low oil pressure alarms and shutdown, thermosyphon oil cooling, discharge stop/check valve, suction valve (i.e., combination stop/check/strainer valve), electronic overload protection with alarm and shutdown conditions, and pressure relief valves.



The intercooler has the following safeguards:  dual pressure relief valves, high and low level alarms and shutdown, continuous level controller, and liquid level sight glass.



Evaporative Condenser has the following safeguards:  dual pressure relief valves, liquid level indicator, water pump startup and shutdown, and high pressure over-ride.



High pressure receiver has the following safeguards:  dual pressure relief valves, level column with level indicator and level sight glass, and high and low level alarms and shutdown.



Evaporators have the following safeguards:   high and low level alarms and shutdown, temperature controls, liquid level alarm and shutdown, liquid level gauge, pressure relief valves, high and low pressure alarms and shutdown, emergency stop switch, and pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping.



Plate and Frame Chiller:  high and low level alarms and shutdown, temperature controls, liquid level gauge, and high and low pressure alarms and shutdown.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility produces bakery products which are frozen for shipment by using an ammonia refrigeration system (system).  The system contains approximately 28,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia which is liquified under pressure.

  

Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility endeavors to eliminate accidents and health hazards to Associates, customers, and the community by having procedures to provide Associates educational training, safe working conditions, and the means to increase awareness of potential dangers both on and off the job.  Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility's objective is to prevent unwanted releases of ammonia that could potentially expose Associates and others to serious hazards.  An effective program requires a systematic approach to evaluating the entire system.  Workplace and process safety are major concerns to management and Associates alike.  The prevention and mitigation of unwanted releases of ammonia that could expose Associates and the community to serious hazards is of primary concern.   



Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility has developed this program in accordance with OSHA Title 29 CFR 1910.119, and the USEPA Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The program is designed to inform all Associates of the hazards of ammonia, procedures for the safe use of ammonia, and the steps taken for the safety of Associates in the event of a release or spill (i.e., emergency response plan, management of change procedures, preventative maintenance program, associate training, etc.).  



Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility has had one accidental release over the last five years.



Rich Products Corporation - Morristown I Facility has an emergency response program written to comply with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 (n), OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38, and USEPA 40 CFR 68.95.  These regulations establish the parameters to be included in the emergency response plan.
